text.6_Chapter, 4_Verse: if I have dealt evil to my ally—I who rescued my foe without reward—
text.6_Chapter, 5_Verse: then let the enemy pursue and overtake me; let him trample my life to the ground, and lay my body in the dust. Selah.
text.16_Chapter, 7_Verse: Protect me as the apple of your eye, under the shadow of your wings, cover me up.
text.19_Chapter, 0_Verse: 1. For the conductor, a song of David.
text.19_Chapter, 1_Verse: 2. The Lord will answer you on a day of distress; the name of the God of Jacob will fortify you.
text.19_Chapter, 2_Verse: 3. He will send your aid from His sanctuary, and support you from Zion.
text.19_Chapter, 3_Verse: 4. He will remember all your meal offerings and He will accept your fat burnt offerings forever.
text.19_Chapter, 4_Verse: 5. He will give you as your heart [desires], and all your plans He will fulfill.
text.19_Chapter, 5_Verse: 6. We will rejoice in your salvation, and assemble in the name of our God; the Lord will fulfill all your requests.
text.19_Chapter, 6_Verse: 7. Now I know that the Lord saved His anointed; He answered him from His holy heavens; with the mighty acts of salvation from His right hand.
text.19_Chapter, 7_Verse: 8. These trust in chariots and these in horses, but we with the mentioning of the name of the Lord our God.
text.19_Chapter, 8_Verse: 9. They kneel and fall, but we rise and gain strength.
text.19_Chapter, 9_Verse: 10. O Lord, save [us]; the King will answer us on the day we call.
text.23_Chapter, 0_Verse: This is a song, written by David. The Land and everything within it is God’s; and the inhabited land (cities) and all who dwell within it [are God’s].
text.23_Chapter, 1_Verse: Because He is the one Who founded [the Land] on the seas; [and He is the one Who] set it up on the rivers.
text.23_Chapter, 2_Verse: Who will ascend upon the mountain of God? And Who will arise in His holy [or: distinguished] place?
text.23_Chapter, 3_Verse: The one who has clean hands, a pure heart; who has not raised My soul to falsehood and not sworn to deceive.
text.23_Chapter, 4_Verse: He [the man] will carry blessing from God and [carry] tzedakah from the Lord of his salvation.
text.23_Chapter, 5_Verse: This is the generation [or: group] who seek Him; the [ones] who seek your face [are] Yaakov- Selah.
text.23_Chapter, 6_Verse: Raise up, gates, your heads and become eternal portals; and the Honored King will come!
text.23_Chapter, 7_Verse: Who is this Honored King? [He is] God, mighty and valiant;[He is] God, valiant in war!
text.23_Chapter, 8_Verse: Raise up, gates, your heads! Become eternal portals! And the Honored King will come!
text.23_Chapter, 9_Verse: [But] Who is this, this Honored King? [The] God of Legions; this is the Honored King! Selah.
text.44_Chapter, 0_Verse: Al la ĥorestro. Por ŝoŝanoj. Instrua ama kanto de la Koraĥidoj.
text.44_Chapter, 1_Verse: Mia koro pleniĝis per bona temo; Mi kantos pri reĝo; Mia lango estas kiel plumo de lerta skribisto.
text.44_Chapter, 2_Verse: Vi estas la plej bela el la homidoj; Ĉarmo estas sur viaj lipoj; Tial Dio benis vin por ĉiam.
text.44_Chapter, 3_Verse: Zonu vian lumbon per glavo, Vi, forta per via majesteco kaj beleco.
text.44_Chapter, 4_Verse: Kaj en via beleco prosperu, forrajdu por la vero, Por justeco al la humiluloj;Kaj via dekstra mano montros miraklojn.
text.44_Chapter, 5_Verse: Viaj sagoj estas akraj; Kaj, faligante antaŭ vi la popolojn,Ili penetros en la koron de la malamikoj de la reĝo.
text.44_Chapter, 6_Verse: Via trono estas Dia trono por ĉiam kaj eterne; La sceptro de via regno estas sceptro de justeco.
text.44_Chapter, 7_Verse: Vi amas virton kaj malamas malvirton; Tial Dio, via Dio, oleis vin per oleo de ĝojo pli ol viajn kamaradojn.
text.44_Chapter, 8_Verse: De mirho, aloo, kaj kasio odoras ĉiuj viaj vestoj; En palacoj eburaj ĝojigas vin muziko.
text.44_Chapter, 9_Verse: Reĝidinoj estas inter viaj karulinoj; Ĉe via dekstra flanko staras edzino en Ofira oro.
text.44_Chapter, 10_Verse: Aŭdu, filino, rigardu, kaj klinu vian orelon, Kaj forgesu vian popolon kaj la domon de via patro;
text.44_Chapter, 11_Verse: Kaj kiam la reĝo deziros vian belecon, Ĉar li estas via sinjoro, tiam vi kliniĝu antaŭ li.
text.44_Chapter, 12_Verse: Kaj la filino de Tiro venos al vi kun donacoj; Petegos antaŭ vi la riĉuloj de la popolo.
text.44_Chapter, 13_Verse: En sia plena ornamo estas interne la reĝidino; El ora teksaĵo estas ŝia vesto.
text.44_Chapter, 14_Verse: En broditaj vestoj ŝi estas kondukata al la reĝo; Post ŝi estas kondukataj al vi knabinoj, ŝiaj koleginoj.
text.44_Chapter, 15_Verse: Ili estas kondukataj kun ĝojo kaj kantoj; Ili eniras en la palacon de la reĝo.
text.44_Chapter, 16_Verse: Anstataŭ viaj patroj estos viaj filoj; Vi faros ilin princoj sur la tuta tero.
text.44_Chapter, 17_Verse: Mi memorigos vian nomon de generacio al generacio; Tial gloros vin popoloj ĉiam kaj eterne.
text.47_Chapter, 0_Verse: A song [written by] the sons of Korach
text.47_Chapter, 1_Verse: God is great and immensely praised; in the city of our Lord, His distinguished mountain.
text.47_Chapter, 2_Verse: ‘[Because of] its beautiful condition, the entire land celebrates; the mountain of Zion is the innermost chambers of the North - the dwelling of a great King.
text.47_Chapter, 3_Verse: The Lord is in its [the city’s] castles; [He is] known as a protector.
text.47_Chapter, 4_Verse: Because, when all the kings converged together, they also passed [fled] together,
text.47_Chapter, 5_Verse: They saw and were immediately startled; they were terrified and fled, panic stricken,
text.47_Chapter, 6_Verse: A trembling seized them there; like a woman’s birth pains,
text.47_Chapter, 7_Verse: With an Eastern wind You broke the ships of Tarshish.
text.47_Chapter, 8_Verse: Just like we heard, so too, we saw, In the city of the God of Legions, in the City of our Lord; [May] the Lord [will] sustain her [Yerushalayim] for ever! Selah.
text.47_Chapter, 9_Verse: ‘[Previously] we [only] imagined Your kindness, God, within Your temple.
text.47_Chapter, 10_Verse: Just like Your name, so too Your praise [or emanations] reach to the ends of the earth; Righteousness fills Your right hand.
text.47_Chapter, 11_Verse: Har Tzion will rejoice; the Daughters of Yehudah will celebrate, because of Your judgments.
text.47_Chapter, 12_Verse: Rally around Tzion and encircle it; count its towers,
text.47_Chapter, 13_Verse: Mark with your hearts the wall; elevate its palaces.
text.47_Chapter, 14_Verse: This is the God, our God, for eternity; He will direct us ‘Al-Mut’.
text.69_Chapter, 0_Verse: For the conductor (David) to be mentioned,
text.80_Chapter, 0_Verse: To the victor/conductor over the ‘wine pressing’ – by Asaf.
text.80_Chapter, 1_Verse: Sing out in celebration to the Lord Who is our strength; call out to the Lord of Yaakov.
text.80_Chapter, 2_Verse: Rise up in song, play the drum, the pleasant harp and the Navel!
text.80_Chapter, 3_Verse: Blow, on Rosh Chodesh, a shofar; on the covered [time] for your holiday.
text.80_Chapter, 4_Verse: Because it is a law for Yisrael and a judgment for the Lord of Yaakov.
text.80_Chapter, 5_Verse: He placed it as a testimonial in [for] Yosef when He went forth over Egypt…
text.80_Chapter, 6_Verse: I have removed his shoulders from the burden; his hands should pass on [from] the pot.
text.80_Chapter, 7_Verse: You called out in times of suffering and I released you.… I will answer you hidden behind thunder; I will test you at the Waters of Dispute. Selah.
text.80_Chapter, 8_Verse: Listen my nation and I will rebuke you; Yisrael, if you listen to Me.
text.80_Chapter, 9_Verse: There should not be any alien gods within you; and do not bow down to any foreign gods.
text.80_Chapter, 10_Verse: I am the God your Lord Who brought you up from Egypt; open your mouth wide and I will fill it.
text.80_Chapter, 11_Verse: And My nation did not listen to My voice, and Yisrael did not heed Me
text.80_Chapter, 12_Verse: I freed them to their heart’s stubbornness, to follow their own choices.
text.80_Chapter, 13_Verse: If only My nation would listen to Me and Yisrael would walk in My ways,
text.80_Chapter, 14_Verse: Immediately I would humble their subjugators; and on their enemies I would return My hand.
text.80_Chapter, 15_Verse: The enemies of God will feign [praise] to Him and their time will be eternal.
text.80_Chapter, 16_Verse: And He will feed it from the fat of the wheat’s, and from the rock, I will satisfy you.
text.81_Chapter, 0_Verse: A psalm [written by] Asaf. The Lord stands in the Divine assembly; in its midst, the Lord will judge.
text.81_Chapter, 1_Verse: How long will you judge corruptly? And [how long will] you favor the evil ones? Selah.
text.81_Chapter, 2_Verse: Judge the lowly and the orphan; give justice to the dependent and the poor!
text.81_Chapter, 3_Verse: Rescue the lowly and the defenseless; save them from the hands of the evil ones!
text.81_Chapter, 4_Verse: They [the judges] have never known and will never understand- they will [always] walk in darkness. The foundations of the land will totter.
text.81_Chapter, 5_Verse: I said: you were Elohim; and [that] all of you [were] sons of the Most High.
text.81_Chapter, 6_Verse: Therefore: like Man you will die; and like one of the officers you will fall.
text.81_Chapter, 7_Verse: Stand up, Lord, and judge the land. Because You will inherit amongst the nations.
text.91_Chapter, 0_Verse: A psalm and song to Shabbat.
text.91_Chapter, 1_Verse: It is good to give thanks to God; [it is good] to sing out to Your lofty name.
text.91_Chapter, 2_Verse: To declare in the morning of Your loving kindness; [to tell] of Your faithfulness in the nights.
text.91_Chapter, 3_Verse: [Playing] on the strings of the ten-stringed instrument, and on the strings of the lyre; with voice accompanied by the harp.
text.91_Chapter, 4_Verse: Because God you have made me happy in [with] Your work, with Your handiwork I will sing out!
text.91_Chapter, 5_Verse: How great are your works, God; Your thoughts are very deep.
text.91_Chapter, 6_Verse: [However,] an ignoramus will not know and a fool will not understand this.
text.91_Chapter, 7_Verse: When the evil ones sprout like weeds and the evil doers shoot, it is to their eternal destruction.
text.91_Chapter, 8_Verse: And [or: because] You are on high, forever, God.
text.91_Chapter, 9_Verse: Because behold Your enemies, God, behold Your enemies will be lost; the evil doers will disintegrate.
text.91_Chapter, 10_Verse: When You raise up my horn like a Re’em, I am drenched in freshening oil.
text.91_Chapter, 11_Verse: My eye has seen concerning my enemies; concerning those evil ones that stand up against me, my ears will hear.
text.91_Chapter, 12_Verse: A Tzadik blooms like a Date Palm; like a Cedar of Lebanon he flourishes.
text.91_Chapter, 13_Verse: planted in the house of God; in our Lord’s courtyards they will be given to blossom.
text.91_Chapter, 14_Verse: They will continue to produce in their old age; fresh and full of sap they will be.
text.91_Chapter, 15_Verse: To say that God is upright; [He is] my Rock, without blemish.
text.92_Chapter, 0_Verse: God has been appointed King, clothed in grandeur, God is clothed, belted with might; therefore, the inhabited world is established and will not stumble.
text.92_Chapter, 1_Verse: Your throne is right [established] from before; You have always been.
text.92_Chapter, 2_Verse: [1] The rivers have risen up, God, [2] the rivers have raised their voices; [3] they will lift up their fall.
text.92_Chapter, 3_Verse: Above the roaring of the many waters, [above] the might of the ocean’s breakers: mighty in the heavens is God.
text.92_Chapter, 4_Verse: Your testimonies are very true, [the label] ‘distinguished’ befits Your house: God for the length of days.
text.93_Chapter, 0_Verse: God of retribution, Lord; God of retribution show Himself.
text.93_Chapter, 1_Verse: Arise, Judge of the land; deservedly reciprocate on the arrogant.
text.93_Chapter, 2_Verse: How long, the evil ones, God? How long will the evil ones rejoice?
text.93_Chapter, 3_Verse: They express and speak [words of] arrogance; all the evil doers speak their minds.
text.93_Chapter, 4_Verse: Your nation, God, they crush; Your inheritance they oppress.
text.93_Chapter, 5_Verse: They kill the widow and the proselyte; they murder the orphans.
text.93_Chapter, 6_Verse: And they say: God will not see; the Lord of Yaakov will not understand.
text.93_Chapter, 7_Verse: Understand you unrefined among the nation; fools, when you will become intelligent?
text.93_Chapter, 8_Verse: The One Who plants ears, does he not hear? If He creates eyes, does He not see?
text.93_Chapter, 9_Verse: The discipliner of the nations, does He not rebuke? The One Who teaches humankind knowledge?
text.93_Chapter, 10_Verse: God knows the thoughts of humankind; that they are nothing.
text.93_Chapter, 11_Verse: Advanced is the man who You, God, disciplines/punishes; [and advanced is the man] who You teach from Your Torah.
text.93_Chapter, 12_Verse: To give him quiet from the evil days; while/until He digs the grave for the evil one.
text.93_Chapter, 13_Verse: Because God will never forsake His nation; His inheritance He will never ignore.
text.93_Chapter, 14_Verse: Because until righteousness [is attained] judgment will return; and after it all the upright.
text.93_Chapter, 15_Verse: Who will rise up for me against the evil ones? Who will stand up for me against the evil doers?
text.93_Chapter, 16_Verse: If it hadn’t been for God’s help, my soul would have been quickly embedded in silence.
text.93_Chapter, 17_Verse: If I said my feet have stumbled; the loving-kindness of God will steady me.
text.93_Chapter, 18_Verse: With the multitude of thoughts inside of me, Your comforts sooth my soul.
text.93_Chapter, 19_Verse: Could a throne of evil befriend You [that] forms evil into law?
text.93_Chapter, 20_Verse: Can they [the evil] amass against the soul of the righteous? [Can] innocent blood be convicted?
text.93_Chapter, 21_Verse: God became a fortress for me; and my Lord [became] as a rock of refuge.
text.93_Chapter, 22_Verse: And God returned upon them their own might and in their evil He stunned them.
text.95_Chapter, 0_Verse: Canten al Eterno una canción nueva, canten al Señor, todo el mundo.
text.95_Chapter, 1_Verse: Canten al Eterno, bendigan su nombre, proclamen su victoria día a día.
text.95_Chapter, 2_Verse: Cuenten de su gloria entre las naciones, sus actos, entre todas las gentes.
text.95_Chapter, 3_Verse: Porque el Eterno es grande y aclamado, lo asombran todos los seres divinos.
text.95_Chapter, 4_Verse: Porque todos los dioses de las gentes son ídolos pero el Eterno hizo el cielo.
text.95_Chapter, 5_Verse: Gloria y majestad están delante de Él; fuerza y esplendor están en su templo.
text.112_Chapter, 0_Verse: Halleluyah!  Praise, servants of the LORD; praise the name of the LORD.
text.112_Chapter, 1_Verse: Let the name of the LORD be blessed now and forever.
text.129_Chapter, 4_Verse: I and my soul hope for the LORD, and I await His word.
text.135_Chapter, 0_Verse: Praise Adonai for it is good, for God's love is eternal.
text.135_Chapter, 1_Verse: Praise the God of gods, for God's love is eternal.
text.135_Chapter, 2_Verse: Praise the Lord of lords, for God's love is eternal.
text.135_Chapter, 6_Verse: Who made the great lights, for God's love is eternal.
text.135_Chapter, 11_Verse: With a mighty hand and outstretched arm, for God's love is eternal.
text.135_Chapter, 25_Verse: Praise the heavenly God, for God's love is eternal.
text.144_Chapter, 15_Verse: You open your hand, and satisfy for all the living desire.
